body: Can you figure out why it hangs? The script it runs is very simple...

The script `run-compiler` contains:
```
CC=gcc -m32
LD_LIBRARY_PATH=
exec $CC $@
```
Is it missing a quote? Let me test...

This patch would add quotes:
~~~diff
diff --git a/configure.ac b/configure.ac
index 75a882b12..1f822d16f 100644
--- a/configure.ac
+++ b/configure.ac
@@ -191,11 +191,11 @@ dnl Generates a shell script to run the compiler with LD_LIBRARY_PATH set to
 dnl the value used right now. This lets CURL_RUN_IFELSE set LD_LIBRARY_PATH to
 dnl something different but only have that affect the execution of the results
 dnl of the compile, not change the libraries for the compiler itself.
 dnl
 compilersh="run-compiler"
-echo "CC=$CC" > $compilersh
+echo "CC=\"$CC\"" > $compilersh
 echo "LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH" >> $compilersh
 echo 'exec $CC $@' >> $compilersh
 
 dnl **********************************************************************
 dnl See which TLS backend(s) that are requested. Just do all the

issue.title: configure: quote the compiler command

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
Building for multilib failed, as the compiler command contains an extra argument. That needs quoting.

Fixes #11179
Fixes b78ca50cb3dda361f9c1e7a83af7e2e0fa0edbf2

body: Yes, my patch looks the same. ðŸ˜‰

issue.title: configure fails with "--with-openssl=" option for curl 8.1.1

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
### I did this
wget https://curl.se/download/curl-8.1.1.tar.gz 
tar xvzf curl-8.1.1.tar.gz
cd curl-8.1.1
./configure --disable-shared --with-openssl=my_local_path_to_openssl-3.0.8_install
fails with:

```
checking run-time libs availability... failed
configure: error: one or more libs available at link-time are not available run-time. Libs used at link-time: -lssl -lcrypto -lssl -lcrypto   -lz 
```

### I expected the following
configure to run through (it works until 8.1.0)

### curl/libcurl version
8.1.1

### operating system
linux (centos7.9)
Linux machine-name 3.10.0-1160.76.1.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Wed Aug 10 16:21:17 UTC 2022 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

issue.title: configure stuck at "checking if compiler is Tiny C... no" with GCC 4.9.4

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
I did this:

```
CFLAGS=" --sysroot=/opt/toolchains/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/sysroot -fPIC -DPIC -m64" ./configure --enable-ftp --enable-proxy --enable-ipv6 --enable-http --enable-nonblocking --enable-crypto-auth --enable-hidden-symbols --enable-soname-bump --enable-static --disable-shared --disable-dict --disable-ares --disable-telnet --disable-tftp --disable-manual --disable-rtsp --disable-file --disable-pop3 --disable-imap --disable-smtp --disable-ldap --disable-ldaps --disable-sspi --disable-ntlm --without-libssh2 --without-zlib --without-zstd --without-gnutls --without-nss --without-libidn --without-libidn2 --without-nghttp2 --without-librtmp --without-brotli --without-libpsl --prefix="..." --with-ssl="{openssl-dir}" --disable-openssl-auto-load-config --disable-rt --disable-threaded-resolver --disable-debug --disable-curldebug
```
I get
```
checking if compiler is GNU C... yes
checking if compiler is LCC... no
checking if compiler is SGI MIPSpro C... no
checking if compiler is SGI MIPS C... no
checking if compiler is SunPro C... no
checking if compiler is Tiny C... no -> hangs here
```

Very similar to
https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/11179

`curl` version 8.1.1
Xubuntu 22.04, but it happens on other Linuxes also.

There is a patch here: https://github.com/curl/curl/pull/11180

But I don't use `configure.ac` (the file changed by the patch), I am using `configure` directly, so it does not work

Thanks

issue.title: ./configure --with-openssl breaks with release 8.1.1

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
### I did this

```
curl -s -O https://curl.se/download/curl-8.1.1.tar.xz
tar xf curl-8.1.1.tar.xz
cd curl-8.1.1
./configure --with-openssl
```

### I get this

```
checking run-time libs availability... failed
configure: error: one or more libs available at link-time are not available run-time. Libs used at link-time: -lnghttp2   -lssl -lcrypto -lssl -lcrypto   -lz 
```

the generated file `run-compiler` (which seems to be new) looks like this

```
CC=gcc -std=gnu11
LD_LIBRARY_PATH=
exec $CC $@
```

and is run like this:

```
configure:18715: sh ./run-compiler -o conftest -Werror-implicit-function-declaration   conftest.c  >&5
./run-compiler: line 1: -std=gnu11: command not found
./run-compiler: line 3: exec: -o: invalid option
```

### fix 1

rerun `autoconf`

### fix 2

Replace line 6679 of `configure` with this

```
echo "CC='$CC'" > $compilersh
```

### operating system

```
Linux asterix 5.13.0-1.el7.elrepo.x86_64 #1 SMP Sun Jun 27 19:45:23 EDT 2021 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```
